meanings.definition: To predict (something) to be greater or more than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: The weatherman overpredicted the snowfall, but we only got a light dusting.
meanings.sent2: She always overpredicted the time it would take to finish her homework.
meanings.sent3: The fortune teller overpredicted my future so much that I ended up becoming a superhero!
meanings.sent4: His excitement overpredicted the success of his new business venture.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's overprediction of the comet's path led to a thrilling discovery.
